page.title: 06Stoke Albany Village
page.content: Stoke Albany is a small village in Northamptonshire. It is a very pretty village. Lots of wild flowers grow in the hedgerows. There are lots of fields and farms, and quite a few hills in the fields. Just as you come into Stoke Albany there is a fish pond and some cattle. The village is on top of a small hill by the side of the valley, and is built around the crossroads on what used to be the main road from Market Harborough to Corby, until the by-pass was built. Stoke Albany has just one pub, The White Horse, owned by the Manns Brewery. It looks as though it was thatched at first but now has a corrugated roof. At the centre of the village there is an old street lamp made by Royce Thompson. By a wall near Chapel Lane there is an old water pump.
